title: Sampler, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description:
An unfinished sampler with three alphabets, numerals, and an incomplete verse, with a wide floral border on three sides. Embroidered in colored silks on a white ground; the colors have run. 
The verse reads: 
There is a world where souls are free
Where tyrants taint not natures bliss

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-23.
